org.threadly.concurrent

Class PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskConsumer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.BlockingQueueConsumer<PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskWrapper>
      • org.threadly.concurrent.PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskConsumer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    PriorityScheduledExecutor

    protected class PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskConsumer
extends BlockingQueueConsumer<PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskWrapper>
    Runnable which will consume tasks from the appropriate and given the provided implementation to get a worker and execute consumed tasks.

      • getNext

        public PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskWrapper getNext()
                                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: BlockingQueueConsumer
        This function is provided so that it can be Overridden if necessary. One example would be if any locking needs to happen while consuming.
        Overrides:
        getNext in class BlockingQueueConsumer<PriorityScheduledExecutor.TaskWrapper>
        Returns:
        the next consumed item
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if thread is interrupted while blocking for next item
